headline: 'The Five' on reporter's rage after Biden snubs question

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: This has been an incredibly heart wrenching issue. We've watched the photos of Haitians gathering under a bridge, many with families, and the horrific video of the CBP officers on horse -- on horses using bridle and inappropriate measures against innocent people. Those individuals were placed on administration -- administrative leave and will not be interacting with any migrants.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: You're telling us that the DHS chief has the most recent numbers about how many of these Haitians under the bridge have been sent back and how many have been released into the U.S.   The DHS chief is telling us that he doesn't know. So, who else can we ask?

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.sentences: You can certainly ask the Department of Homeland Security. I'm confident, Peter, I am confident that he wanted to have the most up to date numbers and we will venture to get you those. I promise you this afternoon.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.sentences: Is this an issue of not knowing or is this an issue of a lot more people are being released into the U.S. than are being sent out?

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.sentences: That is certainly not the issue.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: I don't know that they know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know that they don't know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It is chaos at the border. There were so many people coming across night and day. I think that the thing they should admit, Jesse, is that they have a massive crisis. That this is a crisis, and it is a crisis of confidence because we don't believe them anymore when they talk about the numbers released, and it is a crisis because no one has a solution.  I have some ideas. We need to have a massive publicity campaign beamed at these countries that are feeding these tired, hungry, poor migrants into the United States. Tell them they are absolutely not to come. The border is closed. And they will be sent back. We need to counter the propaganda --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But Geraldo, that doesn't work.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- that the cayotes have set.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because when they get here, they get to stay. Right, Jeanine?

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes. First of all, you know, when they say they don't know the numbers, that is the most dishonest thing that they can say. All right? To say Mayorkas doesn't know the numbers, Harris doesn't know the numbers and now what they're saying is, you know, we're sending them home. We know they're not sending them home. We know they're lying to us.   And the only way to resolve this is not to do a massive P.R. It's to basically get the border tight just the way Donald Trump did it, to make sure that they stay in their own countries. I don't want to know the reason they're coming here. Let a court decide. If the reason they want to come here is for asylum, are they entitled? They can't just come here and say I want to live here. He let -- open the welcome mat for me. I want education, housing, medication and I want free food and maybe a job. I mean, these people no matter what we say -- Mayorkas says don't come. They're coming.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also, Greg, this hoax with the whips from the horseback. Psaki seized on it. that's a diversion.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They want to talk about the crisis they created. They want to talk about a hoax that the media created.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. I want to get to that. But first, this whole thing about Joe says it's under control. Is control what he actually calls a bridge?   Because it's all under that bridge. But again, he thought the Afghanistan withdrawal was under control.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He thought the drone strike was under control. He thought inflation was under control. One thing we know that's under control, Joe Biden. He is under the control of the hard left who are bent on remaking society. He's an empty vessel. And that's why you're seeing these consequences.  The biggest point though, to this hoax. OK? They're -- the press and Jen Psaki is going after the border patrol for doing their job because Biden and the enabling media wouldn't do their job. This never would have happened if they actually had been kept up with our coverage at Fox of all of this -- of all this harrowing footage, nonstop footage. They had to wait for that one image, one singular image as Chris Cuomo points out so that they can manufacture a story out of one image. It's a consequence, though, of their own corruption. So, what does that remind you of? It reminds you of the media and the Democrats ignoring the rampant, violent crime that started last summer all the way to the present time. All of our cities are degraded, it's a dangerous.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Wait a second.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Stop, Geraldo. Let me finish. I let you talk for God knows how long. So instead, they just totally ignore the fact that we have rampant crime wave. Crime is going up. Homicides are up. But if there's just one singular image, one issue, a police issue encounter that they can use because in that way they can again blame law enforcement and then pretend that they actually care about something.  By the way, the whip story finally, I love it as it falls apart. The media changes the verbiage. So, it went from whipping to wielding to whirling to twirling to swinging. What's next? Conducting? I would love to see the conducting.  Meanwhile, some Haitians attacked a pilot, --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- a U.S. pilot, injured three ICE officers. But is that behavior considered horrific? It's not because unlike the whip, it actually happened.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And when they spin the whip like that, it's not a whip, but when they spin the --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's a rein.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- the rein like that, it's actually designed to make sure that the people on foot don't come too close to the horse because the horse can actually trample these poor people.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, you would know that because you came from Wyoming.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You came on a ranch.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I feel like -- yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I feel like I'm probably just going to repeat a lot -- a lot of what Greg just said. But I think I will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's OK. It makes me feel good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because we kind of landed at the same point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We're on day three of whip gate --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, whip gate.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and they haven't talk about immigration --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- in weeks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not talk about in weeks. This is not enough of a manufactured crisis that the vice president would actually come out and talk about it. And if you -- Maxine Waters today, one of the things that she talked about was, this shows that they want to -- that these border patrol agents want to put everybody back into slavery. It's like they have two moats. You can talk about slavery or the Holocaust. There's nothing in between.  You can't talk about policies. You can't talk about anything like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Also, where was the intelligence about this group coming?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because what we know now is that they just didn't come from Haiti.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Good question. It is a good and fair question.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They came from Brazil and Columbia.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They -- it's 11 days.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Chile.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They came in 11 days. No one saw it coming.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It happened so quickly. And we do want to remind the audience what Dana was referencing. Here is Maxine Waters, no relation, comparing this to something worse than slavery. Listen.

utterances.speaker: REP. MAXINE WATERS (D-CA)
utterances.sentences: What the hell are we doing here? What we witnessed takes us back hundreds of years. What we witnessed was worse than what we witnessed in slavery. Cowboys with their reins, again, whipping black people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, they couldn't figure out anything to say until they got to their comfortable ground of attacking law enforcement.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I actually, I do think that these border patrol agents should file a hostile workplace claim because they work for the president and the vice president. And even the spokesperson at the White House denigrating these people that are doing their jobs. If I could say one other thing, I am for legal immigration. I am for more legal immigration. All of this is making it so much harder to do legal immigration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because the system is completely backed up. And let me also add this. It was announced today that the Pentagon has revealed and State Department revealed, we only got 3 percent of the approved vetted special immigrant visas out of Afghanistan. These are the people who helped us. We completely broke our promise, 3 percent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And so, you can't get them here but they're going to basically roll over and let all of this happen. That makes me sick.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I have to rebut what Greg said --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Please.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- about Haitian immigrants and crime. There's absolutely no evidence. I defy you to find --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, that's not what he was saying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He didn't say that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You related directly --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- these undocumented immigrants.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You misread it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My God. You are so wrong, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You misread it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You -- I'm going -- what I was talking --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What does crime have to do with these people? You know what their crime is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesus Christ!

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Their crime is that they have to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're totally misreading it. I was talking about how the media covers the story.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Let me -- let me --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, because you're lying -- he's screwing it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: These Haitians have been --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's embarrassing, Geraldo. You're embarrassing me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, be embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, because you're wrong. You're wrong.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, you're embarrassed. The Haitians have been --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, no. Let me respond to your lie to your face. I was talking about how the media ignored a story about the crime issue. It wasn't about Haiti.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesus! Apologize.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know what? (Inaudible) in the same sentence.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because they -- what is that story?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You wanted to make this stereotypical linkage.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's so wrong, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And Haitians have been screwed and immigration --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is so wrong. So wrong.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Haiti is 200 miles from Cuba.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A Haitian gets to our shore, --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- they get deported.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I waited an apology for your lie.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A Cuban gets to our shore, they get asylum.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The point went over your head, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK? You just admit it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ahead --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Even with your hair cut.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The manhunt for Brian Laundrie ramping up after Gabby Petito's death is ruled a homicide. That breaking information, up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: First time --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Go to the videotape. Go to the videotape.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He's aggressive.

utterances.speaker: PHIL KEATING, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Hi, Greg. Day four of this exhaustive search but law enforcement in the 25,000 acres behind me in the Carlton Reserve. Just about to wrap up for the day. And throughout it all, still no sign of the 23-year-old young man, the person of interest wanted for questioning in the death of his 22-year-old fiance, Gabby Petito. Searchers are using drones, dogs, ATVs as well as their feet penetrating the area where the terrain is rough, swampy, much under water. There is also a dive team here and cadaver dogs. And side sonar is being used to look for objects or terrain underneath the dark water. Laundrie's parents say their son went here for a hike last Tuesday. According to his parents their sone went for the hike on Tuesday of last week. The following day, Wednesday, they say they came here and retrieved a Mustang that he had parked at the nature reserve, but went home without him. Then on Friday, claiming they had not seen their son in three whole days, that is when they finally called police to report him missing. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Phil. So, judge, there was no hike. He never went on a hike. Right?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Nope.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. So, they're covering. So, if the parents are -- what could they be changed with if they helped Brian flee by --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Now let's start at the beginning.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Ok, what the parents can be charged with. Look, he comes home without Gabby. All right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Everybody knows that he left with Gabby, especially his parents since they had been living there for the past year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So, his parents are already in on the secret. Now the parents, when they go on a trip with him, they buy a new camper, an attachment that they attach to their pickup truck. I don't know the lingo but they have something some kind of a camper. They go away for a weekend, this is what the Guthrie's (Ph) are saying, the people across the street are saying. This 23-year-old goes away for the weekend with his mom and dad camping? You're kidding. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They're either getting rid of evidence that was in the van that he brought home.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Or they are searching out, casing out places where he can hide or where he can say -- they can say they let them off and then they lead everyone on and then on Friday say he hasn't been here when he wasn't there for a week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Have they looked to see if they've like, or checked their ATM records and see if they withdrew any money.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Let me tell you something. They have been on those reports from day one. Not necessarily the north -- the North -- what is it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: North Port.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Port Police Department. And I'm a little disappointed in them that they didn't have their eyes on the -- on Brian Laundrie. But the truth is, they've had their -- the bank records, their electronic records, their phone records, their credit card records. They have gone to every location, every way that they could have figured out that he came back from Wyoming because we now know we left her there to Florida. All right? And how he would have made it back in x number of days. This is really easy. You back into it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And this is a homicide. All right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So, the reason it's a homicide, it's either accident, natural, suicide, homicide. We don't yet know the cause of death. Homicide is a manner of death.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The cause of death is how? Did he strangle her? Are there ligature marks? Did he beat her with blunt force trauma? Is there a fracture to her skull? There's a whole -- we don't know that yet until the toxicology comes back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was thinking, Geraldo, that they weren't -- they didn't want to say the cause of her death was because they don't want to have people with more information calling in that they got from TV. You know what I mean?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, you want it to be fresh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: First of all, I love you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I love you too, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And he's sorry because he was wrong. All right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And I'm sure that you are as well. Seriously, back -- back to this horrible case. And I really -- when I say this, don't think I'm too harsh. When I say that I hope that we find him --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Dead.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Eaten by wolves.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But this was -- or eaten by whatever.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Alligators.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Gators. Gabby's uncle Steve said of the parents, you are as guilty and complicit with this massive cover-up and stolen tactic as Brian Laundrie. And it is almost physically impossible for the parents not to have been complicit. And I think you've got to start there and even if let's say you don't find the kid because he is dead someplace, I think you have to -- and as the judge suggest, I'm sure there is this intense investigation of the parents as well although it appears to have started too late, days late, maybe five days late. But I think that the parents hold the key to the mystery right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Jesse. Put on your little thinking cap if you can fit it over that hair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Got it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dead, alive? What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't want to find him dead. I want him to get pulled out of some sewer --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- with handcuffs and I want to see him suffer and then get the chair. Obviously, he murdered her and then he drove the van back here, scrubbed it. And then him and his parents cooked up this little excuse that he went to the swamp. Probably didn't go there. He's probably in another country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They gave him like a five-day head start. The FBI got played, the local police got played.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It was a sin what happened. The FBI -- what? How many dozens of agents did they try to set Trump's people up with, but they don't have eyes and ears on this guy? This guy is crossing state lines. Probably killed this poor woman and he's covering this whole thing up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This has been a bad track record --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- of protecting women in the FBI. You have Nassar, the gymnast, you have Epstein.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You have this poor woman. They blew a lot of high-profile cases, Gutfeld. We remember the Trump situation. We remember they had the informant of the shooter in the Pulse nightclub. The dad was on the FBI payroll for how long? They got tipped off. The Parkland? Remember that guy was a homicidal school shooter. They didn't even follow up on that lead. So then this happens. I think you do charge the parents. You would know better.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Aiding and abetting, conspiracy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Obstruction, perjury.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They just throw a slew of charges at this couple and make them squeal. They don't know anything. They're not sophisticated people. They'll have to rat out their son. I don't like this part of the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He was reading a book about a dead woman.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's irrelevant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I read books where women get killed. So, if two women get killed in Manhattan, I'm a suspect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Probably.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are more than I am but that doesn't make any sense.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Easy, boys. Easy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK. Wyoming is one of 28 states that still allows the death penalty.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, Dana, what are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I agree with everything here. But I go back to one thing. On Monday, the local police called off the search in this reserve.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which made us think, OK, well then maybe they know something else. But then that afternoon, they interview the parents in the van. Then Tuesday and Wednesday, they're back at the reserve. So perhaps they learned something from there. But I also really think that would be, when it is solved, there's a lot of CYA happening right now. Because --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What does that stand for?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Cover your rear end. Because who failed to put a tail on him?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How was he allowed to leave the house? Did he flee the country? If that was the case, why wasn't the FBI paying attention? And then also there's all the cyber aspect of it. There's all the phones, there's all the sorts of evidence. And some weird messages that he left like on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- he had a Pinterest account.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, I didn't know that guys had Pinterest accounts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That suspect right there. I do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You have a Pinterest account?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course, you do. Probably for your dog.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: For all of your, like all your recipes and crafts?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I actually get rid of that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But he shared with Gabby and his mother.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. All right. Coming up, the liberal press furious after getting thrown out of the Oval Office while trying to ask Biden questions. What song could this be?

utterances.speaker: BORIS JOHNSON, BRITISH PRIME MINISTER
utterances.sentences: I think we'll be OK if we just have a couple of questions, just, just, just a couple of questions for you.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: Good luck.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Mr. President --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: He -- no, ask him a question.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: That's the Good Friday Agreement. That's, that's the --

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Let's go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Own it. You are the leader of the free world. You have just given a speech about human rights, freedom, and democracy. Freedom of the press is part of that. And you're sitting with Boris Johnson, the second most powerful man in the world and you're not giving him a moment? You've already really made him look bad in his own country because he denied allowing people to travel here for so long. Just changes at the night before. So, I forgot to tell Boris Johnson so he couldn't even take credit for that. I think what happened is that the White House team told the Brits we're not going to take any questions. And Boris Johnson is sitting there and he's like, like, we can do that, right? Surely, we can do that. And we have to be so rude to him. I want to know, what happened to the return to norm's crowd? And the democracy dies in darkness brigade? Where did all of them go? Now, I understand that the press is mad. But the problem is they didn't start complaining during the campaign when they couldn't have access -- they could complain a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But they treated him with kid gloves and now they're mad. And one of the things that the White House did today, is they blamed the Brits for surprising them with taking questions. But in terms of return to norms, traditional meetings with the foreign leader, you always get two and two. Two questions aside. That's the return to normal.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What about the fact, Greg, that Biden seems, President Biden seems to have gone from the aggrieved victim to the perpetrator of this obfuscation?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, he gets ornery. He gets angry. He's getting old. It's just, what just happened there it shows you that even the staff has a low approval rating of their president. It's like -- this is the fastest disintegrating president in history. I feel like I'm watching a time lapse of the last eight months. And it's not -- you know. But I don't have sympathy for the reporters. I'm like you. You know? They elected this guy. They colluded to suppress the story, the Hunter Biden story that would have disqualified Joe Biden by revealing that the e-mails were indeed talking about China and getting money out of an adversary. Trump was right about this. But it didn't matter. The reporters refused to do their job. So now they got to live with their choice. Right? They got to live with the guy who didn't tweet, who didn't make mean jokes. But hey, he's such a nice guy that he droned a bunch of kids. That's on the press. They elected this guy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, the press behavior, does he get any slack because they were so falling over each other to be obnoxious?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: That was obnoxious?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: That's not bad.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think pretty obnoxious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That wasn't of noxious, Geraldo. That was tame. I'm with Greg. The Press created this mess. The last president was on truth serum. We got everything, full access, uncultured, raw, uncut. And what did they do? They killed the golden goose. This guy gave him ratings and book deals and clicks, but they couldn't take it because they were such partisan hacks for the Democrats, they colluded with the billionaires and Silicon Valley to destroy his presidency. So, now we have a stiff, right? He doesn't give him ratings. He doesn't give them clicks. He's boring. And the press is bored out of their mind, right? So, Biden has no respect for these people. Biden knows they're in his pocket. He disrespects them constantly. Whatever, I'm not going to talk to you. It does it matter. And it helps him because his handlers is just a way of them protecting Joe from himself. They know he's shot. He can barely complete a sentence. And the media gets pretends like they're all upset. Oh, we're going to send a letter. So what? They don't care. It's fake aggression. They'll lob softballs the next time and then Joe will just abuse them with silence and access and it goes around and around.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The reason I can't disagree with Jesse is that there's an example even more egregious. You have the indictment of Michael Sussman, the campaign lawyer working for Hillary Clinton. He's indicted. He was the one fueling the Russia collusion hoax.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, Russia, Russia, Russia was clearly Hillary Clinton's creation, and the press is not touching it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they are not touching it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's like it's a not --the non-story after everything -- after the impeachment of a president.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know what I saw today, I saw that they got very upset that apparently the whole pool marches over to Jen Psaki's office and they file a complaint, which I think is really hysterical because I've come to the conclusion that it's Jen Psaki who's saying, you're not -- you got to get - - don't talk to anybody. Take this reporter first. Don't answer anything from that reporter. And you know what Jen Psaki says? Her response is, look, I'm not in a position to offer an immediate solution. But the truth is that the President answers questions every day. That's her response. That's her solution. Except he hasn't talked -- he hasn't spoken about the drone, he hasn't spoken about the border. He hasn't spoken about any of the issues that are concerning to them. But maybe now they'll start to get upset realize that you know what, he was condescending. When Boris Johnson said, you know, I want to ask a couple of questions. And he says, good luck.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know, that's condescending. They can't get an answer from him. They don't have access. That's First Amendment. You know what, maybe they'll figure it out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They've been nicer to the Taliban.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But wait a minute. You know, I was going to -- don't you get that the -- don't you feel like the media is terrified of Jen Psaki?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's tough. Look, she's tough. She's good at her job.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Jen Psaki is the most competent person in the Biden administration.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: She is --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She has to be --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: She should be -- she should be the president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's not saying a lot, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: She may not, but I think she has to.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She was very good at her job.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: She can shut it down.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, she's also fielding questions from libs, Geraldo. That's not tough.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm not -- Peter Doocy is no lib. He's a tough --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's one guy. One guy, not a lib.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: One can be enough.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Ahead, President Biden nose-diving in the polls, sparking new fears he could drag down Democrats and lead to a big, big red wave.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The red wave warning growing more intense for Democrats as President Biden continues his free fall in the polls. Swing state voters are reportedly getting buyer's remorse with the President's approvals sinking fast in several battleground states like Michigan, Virginia, and Iowa. And making matters worse for Biden, the Democratic Party is currently feuding over aspects of his trillion-dollar spending agenda. OK, on the one hand, you know, Joe Biden -- I'll start with you, Dana. Joe Biden started out saying he's going to unify everybody. And now, it appears he can't even unify his own party because he's -- on the one hand, he's got these leftist, progressive Democrats, and then he's got the more moderate Democrats, and now he's got the $3.5 trillion spending bill that is, you know, apparently causing a lot of people to say we didn't send -- we didn't vote for him to do this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: One of the reasons Biden said that he won the primary with the Democrats is that he was more moderate, and then he wasn't progressive like Bernie Sanders. And then he became president, and all of a sudden, he's being led around by the nose by the progressives, and the Bernie Sanders crowd. And the moderates who actually have very tough races, who will need something to bring home, they want this infrastructure bill, and then they'll talk about the $3.5 trillion. The $3.5 trillion, that's got the progressives all worried. So, now, they're at a stalemate. That's why they -- instead of meeting with Republicans today to try to get them to support the bills, he's having to meet with his own people. And we'll see. He might have some success there. They might figure out a way to save some face and bring some things together. But one of the problems is, he is mishandling all these other issues we've talked about, the border, Afghanistan, and inflation also being another issue, that -- and crime let me add that one. It's making his political capital account decrease.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, you know in addition to that, I mean, you look at Iowa -- I mean, his approval rating is 31 percent in Iowa. I mean, that is -- that's pretty --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's still higher than Geraldo's though.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but his job approval --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Not in Cleveland.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but his job approval is 43 percent overall. But Iowa which is really important state, 31 percent, it's like don't even show up there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But here's the thing. Joe's approval was at his highest when he wasn't working. So -- when he was in hiding -- he was -- he was the player to be named later or other, right? And then the more he does his job, right, the faster his approval evaporates. So, my solution for him if I was running -- if I was his chief of staff cryogenics, freeze him until 2022. Defrost him, like a Swanson's dinner, bake back better. That would be his new thing. Because right now, everything you're saying is correct. Nobody's buying Moderate Joe anymore. He's like those one -- Geraldo will remember this. He's like those one-dimensional towns that they used in western TV shows. They can fool you until it suddenly just falls over.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think you're discriminating against older people.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but what do you say, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm as sharp as I've ever been. I think that Joe Biden's coattails are clearly shrinking. And I think that the biggest impact is not the midterm election. I think you've got this $3.5 trillion, you know, omnibus spending bill that requires all 50 senators. I think, Sinema and Manchin, the two rebels, will be empowered by his diminishing popularity. And if you can't get 50 senators on the floor -- well, this also collapse the infrastructure bill, the $1.9 trillion infrastructure bill. Will this hamper his ability to, you know, lift the debt ceiling and all the rest of it? I think that if he is as wounded as this before the first year is even out, I think it does spill problems. I'm no big political expert, but it seems to me it spills problem.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, Jesse, with Manchin and Cinema, you know, they can't convince them to turn around, Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. And I'll be brief because I want to save time for Geraldo's apology to Gutfeld. But I don't know if you've noticed this, Judge, but my friends and family who are Democrats, they don't defend Biden. I asked them, hey, how's it going, guys? They say, dot look at me. And it's true. It's like no one is a Biden voter. It's like being a Carter voter and as a stench that's wafting around from it because everything he touches dies.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I like President Carter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then he lies about it and hide. So, we know what's going on with Joe. It's a matter of in next year is he going to be so toxic in these swing states in the 30's still that are other Democrats running? Are they going to distance themselves from Joe Biden?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that's the question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think if he remains on this course, yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK, "THE FASTEST" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to "THE FASTEST." OK, first off, we're going to have some apologies here on THE FIVE. OK, I'm going to -- I'm going to go first. I apologize to Pinterest and all the men who are on Pinterest. Jesse Watters has a Pinterest account. I didn't know that. And also, Joey Jones has a Pinterest account where he gets great tips for woodworking and things like that. I had no idea, so apologies.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's not a porn site.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The next apology is going to come from Geraldo, and here's why. Remember, in the A block, Geraldo misunderstood something Greg said. I'll read to you what Greg said. Greg: "So what does that remind you of? It reminds you of the media and the Democrats ignoring the rampant violent crime that started last summer all the way to the present time. All of our cities are degraded. Stop and let me finish, Geraldo. I let you talk, Geraldo, for God knows how long. So, instead, they just totally ignore the fact that we have rampant crime. Wave crime is going up, homicides are going up. But if there's just one singular image, one issue, a police issue encounter that they can use, because in that way they can again blame law enforcement and then pretend that they actually care about something." That was what Greg said. He did not say Haitians are causing crime to go up.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I apologize, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I accept your apology.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But I didn't finish. I apologize because I believe you were very clever, right, very, very talented and it is a pleasure being on the program with you. My problem with what you said is the juxtaposition. Even though you did not intend it between violent crime, which is a separate topic, and you made that clear in the -- in the point, and that's why I apologize, and the Haitian immigrants. They have enough problems to be lumped in the same paragraph with urban crime, I think, does them a disservice. But I apologize to you did not achieve the intention.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I accept your apology, conditioned apology. And I would like to say that we are not -- we should never turn into the view.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We cannot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We cannot turn to the view become emotional about things.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And you can't make me a conservative.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have to be Vulcans.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I will say that everybody started laughing in the commercial breaks. Also, this happened yesterday on THE FIVE and we had a major controversy about it. It involved a bear. It's bitterly divided. Here's what happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a man in a costume.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That is -- it is real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a man in a costume.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is a dude in a bear suit.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, it's not. It's true, everybody. I'm a judge. It must be true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, is the bear in Judge Jeanine's "ONE MORE THING" real? We send a highly skilled team investigators to Russia to find out. I'm just kidding. We did not. But our producers reached out to the woman on social media and she confirms that the bear is real, and says that she rescued him from a safari park.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And she married him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look how he's walking. That is so fake.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He used to be my co-anchor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know what, I got to say, Judge, you know --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's real. I'm not apologizing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You have destroyed the credibility of "ONE MORE THING." No one is going to trust our animal videos anymore.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, she got him from the safari park.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wait, you guys. It's real.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It is real.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You believe the Russians, Dana? The Russian said it's real and you're buying that? The thing was walking like Geraldo after three drinks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, he is real and he's great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Did you believe in the Russian (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not -- I'm not apologizing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is real as the dossier.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think Greg should apologize for yelling it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I apologize for your condition -- but she deserved it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Look at this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, anyway, Judge -- and finally --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Aren't there laws against that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- karaoke a car might not be such a great idea after all. A study warns that listening to music and sing along songs like the hits while behind the wheel increases your chances of making mistakes. I know you like popular songs. I call it the hits.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was driving to the zoo with the twins and Emma was trying to rap with them and she was dropping the beat and then they'd rap and then they tried to get me to do it. I can't rap and drive in the Bronx.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can't rap.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can you rap or drive?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, but especially not together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Peter can rap and drive, actually.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would never say that publicly because now, people are going to force me.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- it's Greg's music that makes him aggressive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What about you? Do you sing in the car?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I absolutely sing in the car and I put -- I put music on and then --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What's your favorite song?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: -- I go faster?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, we know that, Judge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Maybe put some mellow music, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the point. They're saying that you get distracted.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Johnny Mathis, who do you like?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, I like the Eagles.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The Eagles?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I love the Eagles. Do you know -- and I love -- I love Toby Keith.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I never sing in the car. I don't listen to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Your music doesn't really have words.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's the best kind. I was pulled up next to Jesse. He air drums on the steering wheel. He's like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I can feel it coming -- I'm not singing. That was not a song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It almost happened.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That didn't happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He walked right into it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And I want to apologize for that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wait, Judge, are you apologizing for anything?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Not to Brian Laundrie. He's not getting an apology.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, all right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I didn't insult anyone, did i?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I apologize to our producers for going over time. "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Time now for "ONE MORE THING." So, I was playing golf with my dad and some people yesterday for charity.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, stop laughing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It was the Planting Fields Foundation. We were raising money for - - they manage a 400-acre original homestead landscape in Oyster Bay that's open to the public year-round. Check it out at plantingfields.org. There's my caddy, Steve. I shot an 89. The first time ever I broke the 90. See, Greg, I don't take off for my birthday. I take off for charity.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You take off for charity.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's the difference between you and I. Many differences, that's just one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Did you cheat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Mulligan on front nine and the back nine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, Nicole Richie's 40th birthday was lit. And I mean, literally. This happened at her birthday party. She posted the picture. She leaned over her cake to blow out. And her hair caught on fire.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Remember Michael Jackson?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, this is so scary. And thankfully, everything is fine. She'll have a cute little new haircut. Just be careful out there, everybody?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That was intense.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, follow that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is a lot of fun back in the early 2000s. Let's do this. Greg's how many nuts part five. All right, what we do is we play the video, freezes, we go around the table. You guys guess how many nuts. Let's play the video. Let's freeze it. There he is. What's going on over there? Here we go. All right, we're going to stop there. Judge, how many nuts do you think he can fit into his mouth? And keep it clean.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I'm counting one. He only put one in his mouth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's a predictive --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, the total.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: How many can he put in his mouth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: How do I know?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesus.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're supposed to guess.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Just say a number.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right, eight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Six.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, let's roll the tape.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Two, three, four --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There not enough in his hands.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Five.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Come on, keep going. You can do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Six.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Come on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Am I going to win the nut game?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Come on, don't just -- seven, eight, oh, nine --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It stopped at eight.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I won. I won.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I knew it. I knew.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And I don't know anything about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You didn't even know anything about it and you win.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I didn't know anything about it and I won. It goes to show you. I was right about the bear too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are not about the bear.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The bear is eating nuts?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I wonder if how many nuts a bear could eat.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I wonder how many people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's how swollen they are, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, we're not coming back. Is it my turn?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Judge, you're up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. I'm very happy. You know why? The Afghan girls, the national soccer team has been granted asylum -- I'm sorry -- in Portugal. You know, you know, the Taliban, they kept saying oh, we're going to let women go to school, we reserve their rights. Yeah, right. They ban women from playing sports. Now these young women and their family members, a group of 80, they went from safe house to safe house. They are now living in Lisbon, the capital of Portugal.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Bravo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They arrived on Sunday. And there -- they have their family members with them, the players between the ages of 14 and 16. Bravo to the team. Bravo to Portugal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why didn't we get the good soccer players? We give them the Portugal? Come on. We got the Olympics coming up. Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's what -- immigrant vigor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Soccer is not the only sport.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Immigrants help the country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Remember they were kneeling all over the place?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Now, we're ready for this edition of Geraldo's Geraldo news with Geraldo. My hotel was swarming with Secret Service and cops. They were all over the place. I love cops, so I got out and I had to say hello. They are such good people. They were guarding the hotel because President Erdogan of Turkey, very controversial Turkish president was staying in my hotel and they were afraid of assassination attempts. He had a coup attempt against him. The cops and I speak the same language unlike me and Greg. They really are --- they're amazing people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We just had this on a loop?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, this is on the loop. OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is this your "ONE MORE THING?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can tell they're really, really thrilled to see you, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They are thrilled to see me. You may not be, they are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm joking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're scraping the bottom of the barrel here with Geraldo's news about Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Oh, look at him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Of all the things you do, Geraldo, we could do better than that. I feel like you fit -- you did more than fist bump a few cops yesterday.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You missed yesterday -- did you missed the day that we had his haircut.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, the haircut?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That was yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was yesterday. I'm glad I missed yesterday because I was doing charity work.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Charity work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Our ratings were huge too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's it --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, huge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It was building for Monday.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They tuned in looking for you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's it for us. "SPECIAL REPORT" up next with Bret. Copy: Content and Programming Copyright 2021 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
